boardgame.name: Markets & Merchandise (OpenD6)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"Two high-priced courtesans, a fine meal, a jug of ale, and a tattoo; the best ten gold pieces you ever spent!"

Markets and Merchandise contains anything and everything that your party of adventuring characters might ever want to buy. From adventuring gear and magical potions to manors and keeps, this book has it all. Luxury items, exotic mounts, fabulous art objects, your players will never run out of things to spend that hard earned gold on. Price ranges vary so the item listing will be useful for high level characters as well as a 1st level party that is just starting out. This work is the ultimate guide to shopping in a fantasy setting. Purchasing items is quick and easy so players won’t have to spend hours digging through price lists or converting prices.

All of the day to day items that populate your fantasy world can be found here. This book contains everything you need to create realistic economic systems in your fantasy world. Currency and barter are discussed, as well as places to buy things new treasure parcels. Use this book to decide what sort of goods and services are available in a given area, give a unique flair to your next treasure, or spice up that next urban encounter. Financial transactions and monetary rewards can be handled in all sorts of ways; this book will give you plenty of ideas for spicing up situations where your characters have to deal with wealth, which is often.
The marketplace or trading post is an essential ingredient to any fantasy setting and this book helps you bring that setting to life with hundreds of different items and dozens of services. Use the things found in this book to define the flavor of a setting by filling in important details and providing a meaningful backdrop for your NPCs.

Markets and Merchandise provides prices and descriptions for the following goods and services:


Weapons, Armor, and Gear
Horses and Mounts
Transport
Livestock and Animals
Crops and Wild Plants
Metals
Gemstones
Luxury Items
Jewelry and Artwork
Slaves
Monsters and Rare Animals
Manufactured Goods
Clothing
Musical Instruments
Eateries and Restaurants
Food and Drink
Lodging per Night
Apartments
Shops
Entertainment
Services
Financial Services
Bounties
Temple Services and Religious Artifacts
Medical Services and Apothecary
Potions and Alchemical Items
Land


This book is compatible with the 4th Edition of the world’s most popular role playing game.

boardgame.name: Constructs
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Miscellany Memorandum is a series of short supplements for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Each supplement covers a specific facet of gameplay; whether it’s a new prestige class, rules for magic item crafting, lists of long forgotten spells, or any of a dozen other topics – Miscellany Memorandum has new and exciting options for you!

Today’s topic: constructs! Perhaps the pinnacle of magical crafting, these animated creatures can be a boon to their masters in all sorts of ways – but can become unpredictable if they suddenly spark to consciousness! Inside this memorandum you’ll find several new constructs designs for players to craft or to use in your campaigns, new construct oriented feats and magic items, rules for crafting intelligent items, and more! So step inside the world of constructs, and start “making” friends!

boardgame.name: Food & Drink
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Miscellany Memorandum is a series of short supplements for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Each supplement covers a specific facet of gameplay; whether it’s a new prestige class, rules for magic item crafting, lists of long forgotten spells, or any of a dozen other topics – Miscellany Memorandum has new and exciting options for you!

Today’s topic: food and drink! Even the greatest of heroes needs to eat (unless you’re undead or a construct or something), and what better way to celebrate a victory than a cool beverage at your favorite tavern? Sadly, these two activities are often dismissed to the realm of the mundane – but no more! With this book you can explore many exciting new food and drink options.

boardgame.name: Chili Con Carnivore
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

One Page Playbook is a series of short adventures for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game – so short, they only take up one page! Easy to GM and easy to drop into existing campaigns, One Page Playbook can help flesh out your game world with side-quests, or let you take your group on a one-off separate from their main story. And best of all, they're cheap!

In Chili Con Carnivore, the PCs become involved in a local chili cooking contest. It's all fun and games until bizarre events begin to threaten the town – with one of the chili cooks at the center of the trouble! An adventure for four level 6 PCs.

boardgame.name: Bone Thugs & Harmony
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

One Page Playbook is a series of short adventures for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game – so short, they only take up one page! Easy to GM and easy to drop into existing campaigns, One Page Playbook can help flesh out your game world with side-quests, or let you take your group on a one-off separate from their main story. And best of all, they're cheap!

In Bone Thugs & Harmony, the PCs become alerted to a series of tribal raids on local villages. Tracking down these primitive cave dwellers is only the beginning of a dungeon delve to uncover the mastermind behind these attacks! An adventure for four level 2 PCs.

boardgame.name: Black Friday
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You walk up the path on your way as usual to the Fantasia Tavern, Dimble's finest proprietor of food and drink(or at least you believe it is). A huge crowd of Dimble-ites has gathered in the middle of the square in front of the Fantasia. Confused and stunned as to what is going on, you look around for a familiar face that might be able to answer your questions. Your search ends when you notice Cecily and Brath standing outside the Fantasia's doors. Cecily waves as you approach but Brath just stares at the crowd, anger and disgust coursing through his rugged face.

“What the bloody Nath is going on out here?” you are almost afraid to ask.

boardgame.name: The Night that Brought Evil
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The light of the day begins to wane. Night comes earlier starting this time of year. It's All Hallow's Eve and there is no finer way than to celebrate tonight at the Fantasia Tavern. At least that's what you've been thinking all day.

A slight chill rushes past you. It's been unusually warm during the day but the night reminds you of the season. Your pace quickens not only to warm yourself, but to get you to the Fantasia with haste. This is the first year since the curse on the Town of Dimble has been lifted and you do not want to miss a thing.

Your thoughts of the festivities lose focus as you suddenly become aware of a sobbing. Soon you notice a woman off to the side of the road with her head in her hands, visibly distraught. Your pace begins to slow as your mind weighs decisions.

boardgame.name: The Game of Games - A D6 Paragraph-by-paragraph Golf Solo
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A D6 Paragraph-by-paragraph Golf Solo Adventure that can be used with any RPG rules.

The simple and unadorned narrative of the most extraordinary and perilous golf game ever played. You read it correctly, golfing!

Challenging: After you have driven the ball, the buffaloes charged you and it was by running for your life that you were saved.

Witty & Laughable: Players driving into the water must positively retrieve the ball themselves, or forfeit the match.

Exciting & Fun: The eighteenth and last tee was played on the back of an elephant. A nasty beast he was, too, but well trained as you found to your sorrow.

boardgame.name: Shipwrecked!
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

An interactive narrative solo adventure for level 1 characters
...
Barely surviving a storm at sea, a novice adventurer wakes on a tiny tropical island.

A mysterious ally offers guidance through many perils as the adventurer engages in a life-or death struggle to escape!

boardgame.name: Shipwrecked! Part 2 - Isle of the Ebon Skull
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

An interactive narrative solo adventure for level 2 characters
...
After escaping the Island of the Sha'ir in Shipwrecked! Part One, you and your ally Aliz'ah sail toward a terrifying place known as the Isle of the Ebon Skull! You must defeat the horrors of the island and weaken the Sha'ir's grip on the free people of the Islands of the Utter South!

boardgame.name: Shipwrecked! Part 3 - Attack on the Sunken Citadel
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

An interactive narrative solo adventure for level 3 characters
...
The council of elders asks that you defeat the sha’ir in a final confrontation! Magical gifts are bestowed as you begin the most dangerous and challenging adventure of your life – an attack the sunken citadel of Black Star Island!

boardgame.name: The Secret of Mud Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the introductory installment of Scarlet Tales, a series of gamebook-style solo adventures in the classic style of old school fantasy!

In this story you can be a mighty Warrior, a cunning Rogue or a mysterious Enchanter, and face the threats hidden among the shady walls of Castle Mud.

Using a totally dice-less gaming system prepare yourself to fight terrible monsters, defeat them with magic or outsmart them with your wits.

Remember, in this game are your tactical choices that make you win or lose, not the random number of a dice!

So what are you waiting for?

boardgame.name: Tops: The Number Game
boardgame.description: A simple race to play all of your numbered tiles by placing them on central ascending stacks or on other player’s piles when numbers are one more or one less. Play one out and have another turn.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Coin
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Coin is a microgame game that fits on a coin.

Game presentation:

The player is exploring a dungeon in order to find gems.
He tries to dodge fights with monsters.
The game is short but the tension is high.


The rules are directly written on the 2 sides of the coin:

Heads - Flip the coin and see your destiny. You find a monster = you lose the game.
Tails - Flip the coin and see your destiny. You find a gem. Having 3 gems = victory.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: polaryCUBE
boardgame.description:
Skill game based on small cubic magnets to be placed on a game board.

Each player receives the same number of magnets at the beginning of the game and tries to place them on the board without them attracting each other, in a chain reaction.

boardgame.name: Sal & Pólvora
boardgame.description:
Sal & Pólvora (Salt & Gunpowder) is a Naval wargame system focused on the Age of Navigation, 1750-1825

Scale:
1 hex= 20 m
ship = 1/600 - 1/1200

Sequence of play:

Wind adjustment
Initiative
Movements
Shooting
Boarding
Repairs
Moral


Contains ships data for France, Britain and Spain

- User description

boardgame.name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Lawless Badlands
boardgame.description:
The Sacred Land expansion contains the following:

42x Bandit miniature (in 9 different designs)
1x Nil miniature
Tiles, cards, tokens and all components needed to play


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game

listing.notes: New and still in shrink wrap

New and in shrink.
Shipping to Germany: 5,99€ To all other EU-Countrys: 13,99 - 15,99€
I have other Horizon Expansions for sale as well. Check them out

I have for sale The Lawless Badlands Expansion for Horizon Zero Dawn Board Game. It's new, in shrink.
I accept payment via Paypal and Bank Transfer.

boardgame.name: 100 Hazards to Find in a Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dungeons can be dangerous places, but it isn't just monsters, intelligent creatures and traps that make them dangerous. There can be a whole host of hazards that can affect characters, from environmental to disease to dangerous substances.

This supplement has 100 different hazards that could affect players. They are typically non-magical in nature and, whilst a few involve creatures, most do not. Many of the hazards are not hazardous at all, unless the characters tamper with them in some way.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Maze: The area is a maze made with metal walls. The passages are tight and the joins where the metal walls meet are sharp.

Metal Plates: Square plates of metal dot the floor. Each plate is extremely hot, causing burn damage if stepped on. Metal footwear will not help.

Methane: A pocket of methane from decomposition has formed here. If naked flames are used in the area, it will explode.

Monster Corpse: The decaying body of a monster is being eaten by very aggressive parasites who will attack any creature that disturbs their meal.

Moss: Extremely damp moss covers the floor thickly, making it very slippery.

One page is the front cover, one the front matter and half a page is ads.

The supplement is also available in a version for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, which has Pathfinder stats for all of the hazards. You do not need both versions.

boardgame.name: 100 Hazards to Find in a Dungeon (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dungeons can be dangerous places, but it isn't just monsters, intelligent creatures and traps that make them dangerous. There can be a whole host of hazards that can affect characters, from environmental to disease to dangerous substances.

This supplement has 100 different hazards that could affect players. They are typically non-magical in nature and, whilst a few involve creatures, most do not. Many of the hazards are not hazardous at all, unless the characters tamper with them in some way.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Puffball: A fungus puffball will fruit explosively if knocked. The spores are harmless but the force of the explosion is not. (If the puffball suffers any movement or damage, it explodes, causing 2d6 points of damage to all in a 10' radius, DC 10 Reflex save for half.)

Rags: A pile of bloodstained rags are dressings from a diseased creature. Examining them exposes anybody doing so to the same disease. (The disease is bubonic plague, see Appendix 1: Special Abilities of the Core Rulebook.)

River: A raging torrent of churning water cuts through the area. The speed and rocks within the river will make crossing it hazardous. (The river requires a DC 20 Swim check every round to cross. If they fail, see Swept Away in Aquatic Terrain in Chapter 13: Environment of the Core Rulebook.)

Rock Chute: A wooden chute full of rocks stretches from an opening in one wall to another on the opposite side. The rocks are tumbling down it with some force; creatures attempting to cross the chute can get hit and occasionally a rock will fly off. (Creatures attempting to cross the area will be subjected to 1d3+1 Atk +10 ranged, 1d6 points damage; those within 10' must roll 1d4 each round, and will be subjected to Atk +15 ranged, 1d4 points damage, on a 1.)

Rock Pile: A large pile of loose rocks stands on the floor. The pile is unstable and too much noise or vibration near it will cause it to collapse. (Any disturbance, such as combat, area-effect spellcasting or speaking above a normal tone will cause the pile to collapse. Creatures within 10' must make a DC 15 Reflex save or be hit by 1d4+1 boulders, each doing 1d3 points of damage.)

One page is the front cover, one page is the front matter, one page is ads and one page is the Open Game License.

The supplement is also available in a system-neutral version. You do not need both versions.

boardgame.name: Oerth Journal (Issue 33 - Jun 2020)
boardgame.description:
From the website:

The Oerth Journal is a magazine dedicated to the World of Greyhawk, and is written by and for fans. It has been published since 1995. Originally produced by the “Council of Greyhawk”, there have been several Editors and a plethora of different authors and artists who’ve contributed to it. There’s an abundance of great content here, just waiting to be placed in your campaign! There’s many new NPCs, side treks, gods, equipment, and things you may’ve never thought of like the constellations of Greyhawk.

boardgame.name: Hinter der Fassade
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Farlorn in the far north is inhabited by frugal people who basically just want to be left in peace. After Frisov was destroyed in the winter of 1040 BF, however, all of a sudden the snow seems to be whirled up everywhere and howling shadows roam the plains beyond the village.
The esteemed village medical doctor Nantralin, who lovingly cares for the sled dogs and karene of the villagers and passing nives, which are essential for survival, is suddenly under suspicion.
A conflict is brewing between the chubby grocer's son Larrik, his long-established parents, the pious Nivesin Sjunda, and the unusually cheerful guardian of the local Firun Temple. Without the help of cunning heroes, the conflict will soon turn into a tragedy.
In times of threat, many a villager accuses the healer and suddenly accuses him of being a stranger.

In a close-knit community somewhere in the middle of nowhere, surrounded by a rich heritage lying under layers of ice in its rigidity, it will become clear whether research and evidence can triumph over paranoia - or is the stubborn grocer not just jealous after all? In a race against time, will the heroes succeed in uncovering the story behind the characters in order to stop Farlorns' decline? Or will the monster with the many faces cast a spell over them?


Klappentext

Farlorn im Hohen Norden wird von genügsamen Menschen bewohnt, die im Grunde nur in Frieden gelassen werden wollen. Nachdem Frisov im Winter 1040 BF zerstört wurde, scheint jedoch mit einem Mal überall der Schnee aufgewirbelt zu werden und heulende Schatten durchstreifen die Ebenen jenseits des Dorfes.
Der geschätzte Dorfmedicus Nantralin, der sich liebevoll um die überlebenswichtigen Schlittenhunde und Karene der Dörfler und durchziehenden Nivesen kümmert, steht plötzlich unter Verdacht.
Zwischen dem pausbäckigen Krämersohn Larrik, seinen alteingesessenen Eltern, der frommen Nivesin Sjunda, und dem ungewöhnlich vergnügten Hüter des örtlichen Firuntempels brodelt ein Konflikt, der sich ohne die Hilfe von gerissenen Helden bald zu einer Tragödie entwickeln wird.
Denn in Zeiten der Bedrohung erhebt manch ein Dörfler Anklage gegen den Heilkundigen und wirft ihm plötzlich seine Fremde vor.

In einer eng gestrickten Gemeinschafft irgendwo im nirgendwo, umgeben von einem reichhaltigen Erbe, das unter Schichten von Eis in seiner Starre liegt, wird sich zeigen, ob Nachforschungen und Beweise über Verfolgungswahn triumphieren können – oder ist der sture Krämer am Ende doch nicht bloß eifersüchtig? Werden die Helden es schaffen, im Wettlauf gegen die Zeit die Geschichte hinter den Figuren aufzudecken, um den Verfall Farlorns aufzuhalten? Oder wird das Ungeheuer mit den vielen Gesichtern sie in ihren Bann ziehen?

boardgame.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 201 - May/Jun 2020)
boardgame.description: Issue 201

boardgame.name: Sphärenklänge des Wahnsinns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The sounds of madness carry the listener away into the sphere of the Great Ancients, into the dreamland and dark places of the Cthulhu myth. The CD was arranged by Ralf Kurtsiefer and enriches DSA-mythos with a cthuloid music.


Klappentest

Die Klänge des Wahnsinns entführen den Hörer in die Sphäre der Großen Alten, in die Traumlande und an finstere Orte des Cthulhu-Mythos. Die CD wurde von Ralf Kurtsiefer arrangiert und bereichert DSA-Mythos um ein cthuloide Musik.

boardgame.name: Das Heldenbrevier der Noioniten
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Noionite Breviary describes the events surrounding a monastery of the Noionites and a member of the order who discovers the secret of an ancient evil power. What's the story about the creature called Yog-Sothothoth? What is the little silver bowl for? And what is behind the so-called dream landings?


Klappentext

Das Noioniten-Brevier beschreibt die Ereignisse rund um ein Kloster der Noioniten und eines Mitglieds des Ordens, das hinter das Geheimnis einer uralten bösen Macht kommt. Was hat es mit der Kreatur namens Yog-Sothoth auf sich? Für was ist der kleiner Silberschüssel gedacht? Und was verbirgt sich hinter den so genannten Traumlanden?

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Vademecum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Cthulhu Vademecum describes the gruesome and horrible thought processes of a Cthulhu cultist in Aventuria, who is slipping more and more into madness. The ardent follower knows that the Twelve and other Aventurian gods are not the only powerful beings of the Komsos, and beyond the spheres there are other entities lurking that are feared even by the arch demons.


Klappentext

Das Cthulhu-Vademecum beschreibt die grauenhaften und abscheulichen Gedankengänge eines Cthulhu-Kultisten in Aventurien, der immer stärker in den Wahnsinn abgleitet. Der glühende Anhänger weiß, dass die Zwölfe und andere aventurische Götter nicht die einzigen machtvollen Wesen des Komsos sind und jenseits der Sphären noch andere Entitätenlauern, die selbst von den Erzdämonen gefürchtet werden.

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Monster
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Gugs, Zoogs and Mi-Go. This set contains dozens of strange creatures of the Cthulhu myth equipped with DSA5 values.


Klappentext

Gugs, Zoogs und Mi-Go. Dieses Set beinhaltet Dutzende absonderliche Wesen des Cthulhu-Mythos, die mit DSA5-Werten ausgestattet sind.

boardgame.name: Natural Instincts
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Nature simulator. Protect the environment, guide the animals and save nature.User Summary

boardgame.name: Unheilvolles Grauen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The fever that came over Selem plagued the minds of the inhabitants of the ancient city near the Sixteen Swamps. People are falling prey to madness and only a few brave heroes on behalf of the Noionites are able to find out what horror is behind it.

The final curtain for Vinsalt leads a young con artist to a small troupe of actors who want to perform a new stage play in the Horasian capital. Soon strange incidents and murders happen. The heroine faces a danger that will cost many people their lives if she makes the wrong decisions.

In What the Fog Hides the player takes on the role of a sailor who visits a village on the Nostrian coast in the service of the Efferd Church. He must find out what dark secret the small village hides and in the process comes across sinister rites and the horror of the sea.

This anthology takes the players into the DSA myth, where horrible things may lurk around every corner, which can cost the hero or heroes life and mind.


Klappentext

Das Fieber, dass über Selem kam plagt den Verstand der Bewohner der uralten Stadt nahe der Echsensümpfe. Menschen fallen dem Wahnsinn anheim und nur einige tapfere Helden im Auftrag der Noioniten vermögen in Erfahrung zu bringen, welches Grauen dahintersteckt.

Letzter Vorhang für Vinsalt führt eine junge Hochstaplerin zu einem kleinen Trupp von Schauspielern, die in der horasischen Hauptstadt ein neues Bühnenstück aufführen wollen. Schon bald ereignen sich merkwürdige Vorkommnisse und Morde geschehen. Die Heldin sieht sich einer Gefahr ausgesetzt, die viele Menschen das Leben kosten wird, falls sie die falschen Entscheidungen trifft.

In Was der Nebel verbirgt schlüpft der Spieler in die Rolle eines Seemanns, der im Dienst der Efferdkirche ein Dorf an der nostrischen Küste besucht. Er muss herausfinden, welches dunkle Geheimnis die kleine Ortschaft verbirgt und stößt dabei auf unheilvolle Riten und das Grauen des Meeres.

Diese Anthologie entführt die Spieler in den DSA-Mythos, wo hinter jeder Ecke Grauenvolles lauern mag, das den oder die Helden Leben und Verstand kosten kann.

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Magie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

This set contains the spells of the DSA Myth Book and the Cthulhu Compendium from the Crowdfunding Pack. The Myth Magic works without the use of astral energy, but instead creates soul trembling and madness.


Klappentext

Dieses Set beinhaltet die Zauber des DSA-Mythos-Buches und des Cthulhu-Compendiums aus dem Crowdfunding-Pack. Die Mythos-Magie funktioniert ohne den Einsatz von Astralenergie, sondern erzeugt stattdessen Seelenzittern und Wahnsinn.

boardgame.name: Schweigen aus Somerrisk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

In the dreamlands there is agitation. Emissaries of different peoples have disappeared and nobody knows the reason. A council of nations sends a group of heroes to investigate the disappearance. In the process, the adventurers stumble upon a gruesome secret in the city of Somerrisk and must prevent the plans of a great old man.


Klappentext

In den Traumlanden herrscht Aufregung. Abgesandte verschiedener Völker sind verschwunden und niemand kennt den Grund dafür. Ein Rat der Völker entsendet eine Gruppe von Helden, um dem Verschwinden auf den Grund zu gehen. Dabei stoßen die Abenteurer auf ein schauriges Geheimnis in der Stadt Somerrisk und müssen den Plänen eines Großen Alten verhindern.

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Wahnsinn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

This set of cards contains Mental Disorders, which can occur when seeing gruesome mythical creatures or practicing dark magic. The set is divided into four levels, which can represent the severity of the madness from which a hero suffers, from phobias, to delusions to complete lethargy, you can find the most diverse mental disorders.


Klappentext

Dieses Kartenset enthält Geistige Störungen, die beim Anblick grauenhafter Mythos-Wesen oder beim Praktizieren finsterer Magie auftreten können. Das Set ist in vier Stufen unterteilt, die die Schwere des Wahnsinns darstellen können, an denen ein Held leidet.Von Phobien, über Wahnvorstellungen bis hin zu völliger Lethargie kann man hier die unterschiedlichsten Geistigen Störungen vorfinden.

boardgame.name: Meisterschirmset - Wahnsinn & Verzweiflung
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Master Umbrella Set includes the Cthulhu Compendium, where you can find more information about Myth Books, Father Dagon, Mother Hydra, the Deep Beings and the Tcho-Tchos. Also included are inlays for the Universal Master screen.


Klappentext

Das Meisterschirmset beinhaltet unter anderem das Cthulhu-Compendium, in dem du weitere Informationen über Mythos-Bücher, Vater Dagon, Mutter Hydra, die Tiefen Wesen und die Tcho-Tchos findest. Des Weiteren sind Einleger für den Universal-Meisterschirm enthalten.

boardgame.name: Staatsgreep
boardgame.description:
In Staatsgreep ("Coup") players battle for control of five countries (Russia, USA, UK, France and China). Players start with 3 country cards each, and gain a new one each round or attack another player to gain their cards. Attacking can be done by showing another player 1 or 2 cards from a single country and 'attack' a different country, or the same. Once a player gets all five country cards they take control of that country. Once you control 2 countries you win the game (3 if you play with 2 players).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dawn of Madness: The Ticking Heart
boardgame.description:
Edward is a clockmaker who, like Claude, also happens to be a family man. Unlike Claude, though, he knows that it is already too late for his family. Or... is it? What if there was a way to undo what had been done? What if he could bring her back?

The first major expansion to the game unlocked by the stretch goals during Kickstarter campaign. Edward Hirshfield, the clockmaker, will be the wanderer, who will have the leading part and his story is going to be a doozy.

boardgame.name: Die Zähne des Kaimans
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

It has been fermenting for some time in the south of Aventuria. While the Kemi Empire has been weakened by a bloody civil war and internal strife, the Black General Oderin du Metuant is planning a risky venture: a land and sea-based campaign to bring the small jungle kingdom finally under Al'anfan control. A campaign that will make the setbacks and defeats of the past forgotten and lead the Empire of Al'Anfa to new greatness. But Kemi is allied with the Horas Empire in the Golden Alliance. Therefore, it is essential to use the moment of surprise and act quickly before the attack calls the Horasians into action and escalates into a great war with unforeseeable consequences for all sides. At the same time, in the shadow of the invasion, many other groups are trying to achieve their goals by all means possible ...

In the struggle for power and dominance in the region, old enmities are awakening and new alliances are emerging. But wars are not won on the battlefield alone. Not infrequently, it is the secret deeds of a few that determine victory or defeat at the decisive moment.

In this first adventure of the Raven War campaign, allies and enemies of the heroes are introduced. It is the prelude to a large-scale military conflict in the Aventurian south. However, the teeth of the caiman can also be played detached from the campaign background.


Klappentext

Bereits seit einiger Zeit gärt es im Süden Aventuriens. Während das Kemi-Reich durch einen blutigen Bürgerkrieg und interne Zwistigkeiten geschwächt ist, plant der Schwarze General Oderin du Metuant ein riskantes Unternehmen: einen zu Land und zur See geführten Feldzug, der das kleine Dschungelkönigreich endlich unter al’anfanische Kontrolle bringen soll. Einen Feldzug, der die Rückschläge und Niederlagen der Vergangenheit vergessen machen und das Imperium von Al’Anfa zu neuer Größe führen soll. Aber Kemi ist in der Goldenen Allianz mit dem Horasreich verbündet. Deshalb gilt es, das Überraschungsmoment zu nutzen und schnell zu handeln, ehe der Angriff die Horasier auf den Plan ruft und sich zu einem großen Krieg ausweitet, der für alle Seiten unabsehbare Folgen birgt. Zugleich versuchen im Schatten der Invasion manch andere Gruppierungen, mit allen Mitteln, ihre Ziele zu erreichen …

Im Kampf um Macht und Vorherrschaft in der Region erwachen alte Feindschaften und neue Allianzen entstehen. Doch Kriege werden nicht allein auf dem Schlachtfeld gewonnen. Nicht selten sind es die heimlichen Taten Weniger, die im entscheidenden Augenblick über Sieg oder Niederlage bestimmen.

In diesem ersten Abenteuer der Rabenkrieg-Kampagne werden Verbündete und Feinde der Helden eingeführt. Es bildet den Auftakt für einen großangelegten militärischen Konflikt im aventurischen Süden. Die Zähne des Kaimans ist jedoch auch losgelöst aus dem Kampagnenhintergrund spielbar.

boardgame.name: Sommify
boardgame.description:
Sommify is a blind wine-tasting board game. Players take turns guessing mystery wines in an atmosphere reminiscent of a drinking game, all while accidentally learning how to blind taste like a Sommelier. Players guess the Grape and Country of the mystery wine using the incredibly simple Sommify method on The Sommify Wine Key.

Wine culture can be stuffy, pretentious, and intimidating. We created Sommify as a way to have fun with your friends while accidentally learning to blind taste like the Somms!

The Somm is the judge of the round and will reveal clues about the mystery wine. Players either bring a concealed wine and take turns being The Somm, or one player plays Permanent Somm and provides all mystery wines for the game.

Players unlock Cellar Doors on the board by using common wine characteristics (Acidity, Tannins, etc.) to move closer to the final Call Zone to declare the mystery wine to the world. Players score points by pre-calling the wine correctly as well as guessing the wine correctly on the board. After all rounds and wines, the point-leader has proven themselves to be the best blind taster in the universe, and may refer to themselves in the third person for the remainder of the evening (bonus points for using the "Royal We").

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Stacknsleuth
boardgame.description:
Objective: to enjoy the treats in the mansion while solving a short mystery before a night of gaming. 1) set up a mansion with treats, trinkets, or drinks, 2) load a story on the companion app, then 3) enjoy the mystery and narrative as you explore each room on the table and in the app.

Components
A physical mansion - can be printed and built out of boxes or drawn on stackable shot glasses, your creativity is the limit.
A device that supports the website to load the interactive story.
The treats, trinkets (could be game pieces as prep for the next game), or drinks to place in each room.

Setup
Place the unique items in the mansion boxes or shot glasses.
Stack the mansion to look like the companion app.
Load the game or story.
If you are playing with somebody over zoom or google meet, make sure you both have your mansion stacked (you could send them one loaded with surprises) and then connect and one of you can open the app and load the game, then present to the group, taking turns reading the narrative and opening physical rooms.

How to Play
Tap on your first room in the app and once you tap “enter the room” (not before) open the physical room. Some rooms cannot open at first, so it is best to wait to make sure the room can open before opening the physical room.
Each room will have a puzzle you can solve that leads to an end solution of the game. You can go back to rooms to read the solutions at any time.

Winning the Game
You win or lose the game if you solve the final puzzle correctly or incorrectly.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Horror Flick
boardgame.description:
Horror Flick is an all vs one game where one player takes on the role of the antagonist and the rest of the players take on the part of camp counselors trying to rescue the campers and achieve a goal depending on the antagonist.

The counselors will be moving to locations constructed by the antagonist to find and build up a simple engine to help them to deal with the problems that arise. Players can fight, hide, search, and run as basic actions. Each player has variable powers and items further the things they can do.

The antagonist will construct the search decks at the locations laying traps and surprises to get the players. Then during game play will move around targeting players trying to complete a goal based off of the antagonist they chose at game start. Each antagonist has different actions they can do.

The winning condition for both sides is based off of which antagonist the player chooses. It could be find key items to escape, rescuing a number of campers, performing a ritual, and the list goes on. Just think of any campy horror flick and how it resolves.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Boy Band Builder: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Boy Band Builder: The Card Game. A Fun & Fast Paced Game for 2-4 Players, 15-30 Minutes.

Game Description:
Now you can build and manage the Boyband of your Dreams. Develop new artists, build your group, and spin it into solid gold! Recruit boys to enhance your group. The boys feature 4 characteristics (Pipes, Moves,Heat, and Cool) which can be enhanced with Star Cards. You can throw shade at the competition and fight for all all the best Gigs. It’s a cutthroat business, do you have what it takes to make it to the top?

Gameplay:
Players take turns in sequence and may take two actions per turn from a range of options. Players can recruit Artists for their band, draw two Star Cards into their hand, play a Star Card on an artist or band, or do a Gig. Players are trying to do all the best gigs before the competition, so they must play Star Cards on their artists to buff them up enough to do the gig. The combination and order of actions is critical to building a band with the stats you need and handle the negative Star Cards coming from your opponents.

The game ends when the Gig deck runs dry, whoever has done the most Gigs and made the most $ wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Slide it
boardgame.description:
This is an abstract puzzle game that plays 2 to 4 players where the players manipulate the board in order to get their pieces closest to the goal before the game ends.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Behind the Bleachers
boardgame.description:
This game falls in an alternate world where colleges are run by the students in a mafia like world. It is a dark horror where the students will do whatever they can to take out the other students that get in the way of them being the most popular.
The game uses a drafting mechanic with area control to spread your influence in different locations to sway other students onto your side and win out on being the most popular girl in the school.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: NEKO-NIN exHeart +PLUS Nachi
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Stand-alone mini-sequel to NEKO-NIN exHeart featuring the sub-character Nachi

boardgame.name: NEKO-NIN exHeart +PLUS Saiha
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Stand-alone mini-sequel to NEKO-NIN exHeart featuring the sub-character Saiha

boardgame.name: Orcs on the Horizon
boardgame.description:
Orcs on the Horizon pits you against an onrush of Orc hordes. Mine silver to pay for upgrades to your archers, knights, and fortress while the hordes march towards you. Build up your archers to take out the orcs before they make it to your fortress. Or, build up the defenses of your fortress to deal with the orcs that do get there. Or, build up your knights to battle the orcs that make it into your fortress. Do a little of each, or all of one, or some other combination to defeat the orc horde.

Orcs on the Horizon is a solo, one card, adventurous, dice based combat game played in two phases. In phase 1, as Orc hordes march towards your fortress, mine silver to purchase upgrades to your Archers, Knights, or Fortress. Archers can attack Orcs around the midpoint of their march towards your fortress. Once the Orcs reach your fortress, flip the card and begin phase 2. In phase 2, Archers aren't used, only Knights and the defenses of your fortress. Battle the Orcs to the death to win the game.

The game was created for the 2020 1 Card Print and Play Design Contest.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Class Option Compendium Vol. I
boardgame.description:
New options for various classes

From the back of the book:

Within this tome you will find options for various classes to use with The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. The alchemical fighter, a master of alchemical weaponry; the occult knight, a fighter with access to arcane spells; the occult scholar, a dabbler in the esoteric in possession of a monstrous spellbook; and the warmage, a new bloodline for sorcerers focusing on melee combat. Players may enrich their characters with the use of these options, while game masters can give their players a pleasant (or nasty) surprise.

boardgame.name: The World of Terra
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The world of Terra is offered as a resource for D100 Dungeon’s fantasy campaign setting of Terra. It has no actual game element, but details people, places and events that have been encountered in the storyline of the campaign and forthcoming adventure books, and has an updated world map. As Terra evolves, so will this supplement, and so it is presented as an expanding resource, that will be updated with each new relevant D100 Dungeon release.

User summary:

Some of this material originally appeared in D100 Dungeon: History and Glossary of Northreach

boardgame.name: Pulpfinder: Fantasy Adventure in the Roaring 20's
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It's the 1920s, the great war is over, but the new peace is threatened by mad cultists, secret societies, evil wizards and the living undead. The old world of magic is being washed away to make way for the modern age, but it's not going down without a fight. Join the ranks of the adventurers who keep the world safe for the ignorant, or else loot the secrets of the past for fun and profit.

Pulpfinder uses Pathfinder to create a world of pulp adventure alongside dragons and magic. It’s fantasy adventure meets the roaring 20s.

boardgame.name: D100 Dungeon Mapping Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The D100 Mapping Game has been designed to provide you with an alternative way to play D100 Dungeon. It combines the original rulebook with cards and tokens to give your quests a board game feel. You will need D100 Dungeon: A Solo Adventure Game in order to use this game.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep
boardgame.description:
Prepare to drop deeper!

Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep is an epic expansion for the premier "drop-style" tabletop game. Face new challenges as you and your brave companions dive deeper and deeper into the dungeon. Unspeakable (yet remarkably adorable) denizens have emerged from the depths, but it is whispered that fragments of the great relic are among them. Will you take up your sword once again and meet the new horrors that await you?

Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep includes:

New huge monsters
Forbidden Pillars
Rules for Relic fragments
Additional races, classes, and quests
All-new coop mode!


...it's time to drop deeper into the dungeon!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/phaseshiftgames/dungeon-drop-dropped-too-deep-and-tavern-tales/description
DD Deluxe + Game Bundle + Superstructure Pledge
Addons Included: Trials and Tools Mini Expansion Limited Promo Pack (2019) Mini Expansion Skeleton Skulls Mini-Expansion Stringy Thingy 50x sleeves of protection Limited Promo Pack 2020 Big Box Expansion + Storage Solution

boardgame.name: Kingdom: Two Crowns – Shogun
boardgame.description: Kingdom Two Crowns will be expanded with post-release updates that will venture to exotic biomes across the world. On day 1 of release, players can journey to lands inspired by the landscape, architecture, and culture of feudal Japan. Play as the mighty Shogun or Onna-bugeisha, enlist the support of the ninja, lead your soldiers to battle atop the mythological Kirin, and form new strategies as you brave the Greed hiding in the thick bamboo forests.

boardgame.name: Armaments of Legacy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New options for using magical weapons, armor, and spellcasting foci for characters of any level.

Don't outgrow. Evolve! Armaments of Legacy expands well-known magical weapons, armor, and spellcasting items, transforming them into storied relics that evolve and grow alongside your characters.

boardgame.name: Kingdom: New Lands – Skull Island
boardgame.description: Kingdom New Lands now brings a 6th island to explore and develop. This will present the greatest challenge never-before-seen in Kingdom, and will put your every skill to the test. Can you survive the nights and be the ruler that your people need?

boardgame.name: A Formidable Invasion: the 1863 Gettysburg Campaign
boardgame.description:
It is late June 1863. Lee's army--now larger than ever before--swarms into Maryland and threatens Pennsylvania.
At this critical moment, General Hooker is suddenly replaced by the respected but yet untested George Gordon Meade.
Can Meade discern Lee's true intentions and stop him?

A Formidable Invasion is a free campaign supplement, allowing players to re-fight the pivotal weeks of the Gettysburg campaign.
Players maneuver their divisions across a vast theater map with the potential to fight a series of interconnected battles.
Our simple rules are only 10 pages, but still include logistics, supply, weather, variable map movement, asymmetrical victory conditions, and historical random events.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Altar of Freedom: Grand Tactical Battles in the American Civil War

boardgame.name: 50 Sea Dogs 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shiver me timbers! This list provides 50 detailed pirates and other scurvy ridden sea dogs to infest your ships and saucy portside taverns with. Included in each entry is the following: First name and surname, gender (most are males but there are a few lasses), a general descriptive element about the character, weapon(s) carried and used, coins on their person, and a special treasure/carried item. Random roll the percentile dice to use just one or a few, or fill up that cursed old galleon with the whole wretched lot of these scoundrels! This list is suitable for historical era and fantasy settings alike.

boardgame.name: 50 Sea Dogs 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shiver me timbers! This list provides 50 detailed pirates and other scurvy ridden sea dogs to infest your ships and saucy portside taverns with. Included in each entry is the following: First name and surname, gender (most are males but there are a few lasses), a general descriptive element about the character, weapon(s) carried and used, coins on their person, and a special treasure/carried item. Random roll the percentile dice to use just one or a few, or fill up that cursed old galleon with the whole wretched lot of these scoundrels! This list is suitable for historical era and fantasy settings alike.

boardgame.name: 50 Sea Dogs 12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shiver me timbers! This list provides 50 detailed pirates and other scurvy ridden sea dogs to infest your ships and saucy portside taverns with. Included in each entry is the following: First name and surname, gender (most are males but there are a few lasses), a general descriptive element about the character, weapon(s) carried and used, coins on their person, and a special treasure/carried item. Random roll the percentile dice to use just one or a few, or fill up that cursed old galleon with the whole wretched lot of these scoundrels! This list is suitable for historical era and fantasy settings alike.

boardgame.name: 5150: Bugs – Breakout
boardgame.description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – Breakout is the third of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe.
All three are stand-alone games.
In fact, 5150: Bugs –Into the Tunnels can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

What: Small group size combat.

Scale: Man to man combat. 1 figure equals 1 man or Bug.

Your Role: Players can Lead from one group of Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia or Star Marines.

Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

In 5150: Bugs - Breakout you can choose to:

Lead a small group of Civilians, Gangers, Survivors, Star Marines or Planetary Militia, each with their own goals.

Play all of the listed groups, moving from one to the other in linked Encounters.

Or if you're really brave; you can choose to go alone.

The bottom line is you can play it any way you like, with any figures you may already have or with the included color counters.

Inside you’ll find:

A man to man skirmish combat system that plays fast and yields realistic results.
Complete rules covering six types of Humans - Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia or Star Marines; plus the BUGS! Warriors, Workers, Sleepers and the Brain. Kill the Brain, save the world!
Two color Battle Boards; one a Tunnel and one a Street. Use them with your figures or the counters we've provided.
Eighteen different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
Seven different Lists covering seven different Factions for you to choose from - all with their own goals.
A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.


Bugs in New Hope City!

In 5150: Bugs Breakout you’re a resident of New Hope City, making ends meet in a usually uneventful life. That’s all going to change as the Bugs have arrived!

You can play the Bug Outbreak from six different points of view – Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia and lastly Star Marines. Each group has their own goals and although they may be different they agree on one thing...

the Bugs got to go!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 50 Scoundrels 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Thieves, looters, brigands, robbers, cutthroats, hired blades, vultures among men… all of them scoundrels. A staple of the fantasy genre, especially gritty urban fantasy settings, these lowlife dogs often go nameless and lacking in detail. Not anymore!

This list offers 50 different scoundrels that are richly detailed– from name and a wee bit about them to what they are wearing, what they are armed with, and what goods they might be carrying on their person.

Each entry provides the following: Name, gender, a general descriptive (appearance, skill, or demeanor, etc.), worn clothing and/or armor, carried weapon(s), carried coins, and an extra carried item of interest (treasure, trinkets, gear, etc.) Why just 50? There’s so much detail there is no way we could fit 100 on a single page!

boardgame.name: 50 Scoundrels 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Thieves, looters, brigands, robbers, cutthroats, hired blades, vultures among men… all of them scoundrels. A staple of the fantasy genre, especially gritty urban fantasy settings, these lowlife dogs often go nameless and lacking in detail. Not anymore!

There’s so much detail there is no way we could fit 100 on a single page!

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: How To Paint a Library
boardgame.description: Free RPG Day product

boardgame.name: Bejeweled Treasures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dozen gem encrusted wonders for your fantasy role playing game!

Need a little something to bring some intrigue back into those locked treasure chests? Characters getting a little tired of just hauling around coins? Want to mix something into dragon's lair that is truly worth fighting over? Then pick up Bejeweled Treasures and find a dozen things to catch the greedy little eyes of even the most jaded of rogues!

Though game system/edition generic, this product line was created with the world's most popular role playing game and all its editions and spin off variants in mind. From old school standards to the most modern versions, the stuff in this product will fit right in. Bejeweled Treasures will also make a fine companion to your own home brewed rpg or other fantasy setting rpgs.

Each entry has a value, in gold coins, for the treasure. These values are based on the classic copper/silver/gold coin format of the most popular game system/editions, where 1 gold coin equals 10 silver coins or 100 copper coins. Feel free to adjust these values as needed.

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 13
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. Though perfect for various modern settings (crime, drama, supers, etc.) this could also be used for generating survivors for post apocalypse or zombie outbreak settings. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.

Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, major of study, and a talent/hobby/interest that the college student has.

boardgame.name: 5150: Bugs – No Retreat
boardgame.description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – No Retreat is the second of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe. All three are stand-alone games. In fact, 5150: Bugs –No Retreat can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

What: Sci-Fi Squad/Platoon size combat.
Scale: Man to man combat. 1 figure equals 1 man or Bug.
Your Role: Players can command from one Squad to a full Platoon of infantry.
Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.
5150: Bugs - No Retreat can be played in a variety of ways:

You can play as a Squad Leader with a full Squad.
You can play as a Squad Leader with less than a full Squad.
You can play as a Platoon Leader with a full Platoon of multiple Squads.


The bottom line is you can play it any way you like, with any figures you may already have or with the included color counters.

Inside you’ll find:

A man to man skirmish combat system that plays fast and yields realistic results.
Complete rules covering five types of Bugs – Warrior, Worker, Flyer, Puker, Queen and Brain.
Color Counters including Fort 373.
Ten different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
Sixteen different Lists covering seven different Factions for you to choose from.
A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.


Surrounded? So what!

Word’s come down from the top. The Bugs are on a roll and moving fast towards us. We’re cut off from any support so we need to pull back to Fort 373. Once there, we hold the fort and buy HQ some time to regroup. With any luck, they’ll send someone to pick us up, but don’t count on it. Doesn’t matter anyway, we just have to do our job.
Do…your…job!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 14
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. Though perfect for various modern settings (crime, drama, supers, etc.) this could also be used for generating survivors for post apocalypse or zombie outbreak settings. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.

Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, major of study, and a talent/hobby/interest that the college student has.

boardgame.name: 50 Goblin Encounters 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More Than Just Nameless Sword Fodder! Tired of simply saying “you’ve encountered 5 goblins”? Want to bring some details into those goblin encounters? Here’s the list for you! This 1 page chart features 50 goblins with details suitable for most any tabletop fantasy role playing game. Included is a singular (first) name, the gender of the goblin, a general descriptive, what they are wearing (clothing or armor), what they are using as a weapon, what coins (if any) they are carrying, and 1 or 2 interesting things (sometimes valuable) that the goblin has on their possession.

boardgame.name: 100 Professionals Set 12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different professionals that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting as well as a cyberpunk/near future dystopia that has many existing modern day occupations and elements. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 5150: Bugs – Into the Tunnels
boardgame.description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – Into the Tunnels is the first of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe. All three are stand-alone games. In fact, 5150: Bugs –Into the Tunnels can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

Inside you’ll find:

Complete rules covering five types of Bugs – Warrior, Worker, Flyer, Puker, and Brain.
A Tunnel Building system where no two tunnels are exactly alike.
24 color poker card size Tunnel Sections.
Color card stock counters representing your Star Army Squad members and the Bugs
Ten different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
Army Lists for the Star Army, Star Marines, and Planet Defensive Force.
Simple Campaign Rules that tie your Mission’s together, giving you a reason to play, with little bookkeeping.
Easy yet realistic rules allowing you to play solo or co-operatively against the game, or head-to-head against your friends.
All this and much more.


It’s just a hole in the ground. Nothing special about it except once you go down there it’ll be life or death…yours. Sarge designated you as the “point” man. That means you’ll be in front. Be aware and alert; your buddies are counting on you. Because, if the Bugs get the jump on you …

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 100 High School Kids 12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different kids you would find in a high school setting. Included is first and last name, gender, class (Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior), and a clique/interest/group that the kid associates with (or is lumped into). Perfect for a variety of modern settings– from light hearted to teen drama to crime, also good for low level supers (particularly teen supers), teenage horror heroes/vampire killers. Also usable for early post apocalypse settings, zombie outbreaks, and/or some cyberpunk/dystopia use. Basically if you need teens and it would be good to know what clique they fit into (or didn’t) here is the list for you...

boardgame.name: 100 Space Trooper's Footlocker Contents
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different things that you might find in the footlocker of a space trooper. Some items are expected while others not so much. Some things are military issues while others are personal belongings.

boardgame.name: 100 Seedy Starport Encounters 12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wandering through the streets, crowded hallways, and cramped businesses of dirty, seedy starports are an endless variety of encounters. Some are travelers from distant worlds while others are natives. This list provides a name for each encounter as well as a role and brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Vehicles for Lot Looters 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list provides a hundred different vehicles that a group of looting survivors might find in a parking lot. Included is the vehicle’s manufacturer and model, the color of the vehicle, a brief description and/or possible problems, and a notable item or two that one might find left behind in the vehicle. Perfect for post apocalypse wasteland and zombie outbreak settings.

These vehicles are based on models that you would typically find in the United States.

boardgame.name: 100 Vehicles for Lot Looters 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list provides a hundred different vehicles that a group of looting survivors might find in a parking lot. Included is the vehicle’s manufacturer and model, the color of the vehicle, a brief description and/or possible problems, and a notable item or two that one might find left behind in the vehicle. Perfect for post apocalypse wasteland and zombie outbreak settings.

These vehicles are based on models that you would typically find in the United States.

boardgame.name: Galactic Vending Machine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's late, you're tired, and the orbital station's diner is closed in recognition of some local planetary holiday. You'd just eat your ship's nutra-maker's mush but you can't... the stupid thing broke down last week. You're starving and the quickest option are the assorted vending machines that line the walls of the station's lobbies. Not really a meal, per say, but it'll keep hunger away for awhile.

You walk up to the nearest snack machine and study the contents. Bags of candy, packs of preserved meat, some weird lab made protein concoction that you don't even want to think about. You spot a mushy breakfast cake sealed in plastic foil and foolishly press the buttons for it. Sure enough the stupid cake gets stuck on the way down, preventing you from retrieving your purchase... you've been ripped off by physics! Cursing, you add more credits to the machine and make another purchase. This time its a pack of meat flavored tuber chips. The chips drop and you grab a canned beverage from another machine before wolfing the meager snack down. Still hungry, you pay for another bag. It is only after you finished the second pack of those salty, greasy, slightly strange tasting chips do you notice that the snack expired over two galactic months ago. This is not going to be good... you can already feel cold sweat on your forehead as your stomach starts to tighten into knots.

Welcome to the real hazard of space travel... the risk of consuming crap out of a neglected spaceport vending machine.

Welcome to Galactic Vending Machine, the sci-fi role playing product that puts focus on the seedy, lowbrow gastro adventures of spaceport vending machine dining! Here you will find twenty different vending machine item selections that you are likely to come across as you wander about that unsavory orbital station or spaceport city. From beverages to snacks to even over the counter medications, this product has it!

Though set in a typical star faring/space opera setting, the details presented in Galactic Vending Machine are carefully written in a manner to make the supplement compatible with most appropriate role playing game systems/editions.

Galactic Vending Machine is not your typical star faring RPG product. Like that lonely bag of chips hung up in the back of the vending unit, this is the supplement guide that you probably thought you never wanted or needed. If you are a fool for crazy little details, however, the Galactic Vending Machine is just the product for you! This supplement painstakingly details a wealth of elements dealing with the vending machine selection entries, from cost to varieties to the chances of spoilage. There's even notes about the chance that the chosen item will get hung up in the machine on its way down! You will also find a fully fleshed out universal rules system for handling bouts of indigestion. Customers into 3D printing will also find 4 models (28mm scale) of the basic galactic vending machine with download purchase of this pdf supplement.

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Cyber City Chatter V 09.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The city overwhelms the senses. Neon against rainy black sky, reflecting in the puddles. Smells of things out of the sewers mix with the deep fried offerings of street vendors. Stale sweat so heavy in the air you can taste it. The most overwhelming of all is the sound… especially the endless sea of chatter. This list provides 100 random things that a group of heroes might hear in a cyberpunk city setting. Some things are worth taking note of, other things are just verbal garbage.

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 15
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. Though perfect for various modern settings (crime, drama, supers, etc.) this could also be used for generating survivors for post apocalypse or zombie outbreak settings. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.

Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, major of study, and a talent/hobby/interest that the college student has.

boardgame.name: Shade of the Never Wood
boardgame.description:
Avalon Adventures Vol 1, End of Year Special

Publisher's blurb:

Avalon Game's End of the year speical, a super sized version of our Acvalon Adventures, encounters and character, all rolled into one big fun time.

Take a dark child, add in a haunted woods and a nasty granny and you have a dark adventure for your players.

boardgame.description:

Fast and Fun, that's the goal of Avalon Game's Pathfinder line of Adventures. Each issue will bring you a small adventure, one that can be dropped into any campaign, used as a single one shot night of fun, or turned into a more complex and longer series of adventures. The goal is to give GM's something that will bring an easy night of fun to their game, without having to cost and arm and a leg doing so.

Fearsome mere-trolls and the even worse mere-hags

boardgame.name: Gloop (Second Edition)
boardgame.description: Take on the role of a teen trying to protect an alien life form that crashed down from other aliens that came after it. The game is a cooperative action point based game.

boardgame.name: Monster Park
boardgame.description:
Monster Park is a co-operative miniatures game designed in 2016 by board game Artist James Churchill. Players use movement cards and individual character abilities to evade or attack. Monster cards determine the movement of each cryptid(s). Gates can be opened and closed within the compound using access codes assigned to each player. Victory can be achieved by luring and trapping all monsters into containment areas, or by all players escaping the compound.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Jodłogrody Małe
boardgame.description:
Firville is about to change! The mayor of this cosy town has just ordered a new suburban district – Little Firville.
The key to the plan is to develop the centre of the new district, which at the moment is full of sad empty parcels.

Become a member of one of four animal families and plan the building of the new district. Assign tasks to the residents of your quarter, send your representative to the bulding site, perform actions and earn materials.
Before the game ends you will need to have proven cunning in order to earn as many winning points as possible.

'Little Firville' is a family game on economy based on the worker placement mechanics.

boardgame.name: TAC-TICS: The football card game for children age 6 to 99!
boardgame.description:
TAC-TICS is a quick play football card game where you are the manager of a football team and you score goals by completing your team's formation before your opponent does. With 8 different formations to choose from - take it in turns to REVEAL, SWAP and EXCHANGE your player cards on your way to experiencing the thrill of scoring a goal playing TAC-TICS. Intuitive and easy to learn TAC-TICS can be played solo, by 2 players or by more than 2 players, create your own mini league or knockout tournaments and challenge your family and friends. Play the Club, International or World Cup versions of the rules for a more complex game.

—description from the designer

The Soldiers of the Sun expansion contains the following:

2x Carja Hunter miniature
4x Broadhead miniature

boardgame.name: Tudor King & Queens
boardgame.description:
A fun-filled strategy game full of intrigue and betrayal set in Henry VIII´s court. Use your cunning to undermine and weaken your rival queens by spreading ridiculous rumours to ruin their reputation - anything to be the King´s favourite and win the crown!

—description from the box

In the game, you are one of Henry VIII's queens who intrigues to become the one Henry VIII will marry. In turn, you roll the dice and go into one of the castle rooms to try to win a trophy poll based on different traits. For each traits you have the most in gives you a trophy token. You win these by either taking from other players who are in the same room as you or playing gossip cards that lower other players' values.
You win either by having at least three trophy tokens and reaching the same place as Henry VIII. You can also win if you are the last remaining queen in the game (other queens can be eliminated if any of their traits end up at too low a level).

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: WOW! What a World of Entertainment AB

boardgame.name: Narcissu 1st & 2nd
boardgame.description:
User Summary
Compilation of the two Narcissu games.

Narcissu 10th Anniversary Anthology Project was released later (2016) with updated graphics and DLCs.

boardgame.name: Himeko's Epilogue
ナルキッソス 姫子エピローグ
boardgame.description:
User Summary

After driving with Sakura Setsumi, Himeko has returned to the 7th floor of the hospital with a single regret.

The game has only been released packed in Narcissu 10th Anniversary Anthology Project.

boardgame.name: Narcissu - A Little Iris
Narcissu 3rd -Die Dritte Welt-
Shuixian 3
ナルキッソス 3rd －Die Dritte Welt－
ナルキッソス 小さなイリス
水仙3
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Previously released in Japan as Narcissu: Die Dritte Welt and later translated and published as a part of Narcissu 10th Anniversary Anthology Project.

Set in Medieval Europe, the story is about a princess that doesn't want to die, and a warrior who doesn't want to live.

boardgame.name: Narcissu 0
Narcissu Zero
ナルキッソス ゼロ
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Background story about the hospice in Narcissu. Set in Japan in the 1970s.

boardgame.name: Narcissu Sumire
ナルキッソス スミレ
boardgame.description:
User Summary

After spending her time in solitude playing video games for the last 10 years, Sumire falls ill and end up at the 7th Floor hospice, where she meets Akari, who spend her last 10 years there.

boardgame.name: Kneipenquiz: Pärchenabend
boardgame.description:
This is a new edition of pub quiz. It is about topics, such as general knowledge, love and sports.

This supplementary set can be combined with the game "Kneipenquiz - Das Original" and "Kneipenquiz-Fußball-Spezial".

boardgame.name: Wingspan: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with Wingspan, and the European Expansion. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The rules and boards act as a lid on top of the trays.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.4 x 29.4 x 7.6 cm.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dune: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with Dune, and the Ixians & Tleilaxu expansion. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The rules and boards act as a lid on top of the trays.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 26.7 x 26.7 x 6.6 cm.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer: Dune Insert Publisher: Folded Space

boardgame.name: Mystiska Magiker
boardgame.description:
The game is about finding out which magicians the other players have chosen. If you expose an opponent, you win his magician. The player who last has a magician on hand, when all opponents have lost theirs, has won.

Each player has a deck of eight cards that show exactly the same magician. Each player chooses one of them and put it facedown on the board. The player roll a dice and goes along a path and performs an action depending on the color you land on. On yellow or green, you can ask one or two questions to any other player. You get the questions by drawing a question card. What you ask is whether the chosen magician has or does not have a specific attribute, such as a blue hat. Depending on the answer, you mark on your display which possible magicians that player may have chosen. If you end up on pink, you can either try to guess another player's magician or if you are not yet prepared to take a pink token that can be used to guess at a later time. If you end up on blue, you have to replace your magician with a new one (but it can be the same) so that the other players have to reset their displays.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Black Stories: Tödliche Weihnachten
boardgame.description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.

"Black stories: Tödliche Weihnachten" is a very special advent calendar. There are 24 riddles to shorten the time until Christmas.

boardgame.name: Sverige Frågespel: Resespel
boardgame.description:
Answer questions about Sweden in these topics: History, Culture, Nature, Geography, Sports and Mixed.

Subject for question is indicated by a roll of the dice and if you answer correctly, you can cross over the corresponding color on your form. The first player to complete a row with five crosses wins.

The questions are written by Dan Glimne, a well-known Swedish game designer.

boardgame.name: Dock
boardgame.description:
1612 A.D. – In a bustling, fishy dock somewhere on the east coast of the American continent, settlers’ ships bring vast amount of goods to the New World. There is a lot to do before the ships can set sail again.
– Listen up, lazy gang! No rest until the ship is unloaded! Pack those boxes tight, we have lots of stuff! Hurry up and move it! The Governor may arrive any minute!

In DOCK you play as settlers of the New World, tasked by the Governor to manage a warehouse. Different boxes are arriving from the ships. Can you load them more tightly than others to satisfy the Governor? Your efforts will be greatly rewarded with silver.

DOCK is roll and write game for up to 10 players and a solo mode for one player. You draw rectangles on a checkered playing area and try to fit them as tight as possible. The 2 dice shows the two side length of the boxes to be drawn.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Alle Neune
boardgame.description:
Roll the dice - run - collect points, always nine if possible. That actually sounds very simple. But it's not that easy!

In Alle Neune, the players score by collecting certain fields that add up to 9. Whenever a player enters a new section with their pawn, they receive a field from the previous section. But be careful! Sometimes players block the coveted fields. And the more pawns that move forward, the more sparse the selection is. Rush forward and collect fields quickly... or would you rather wait? Because whoever leaves a section last can collect additional points.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Unopened, in perfect condition, brand new. Nonsmoker household without animals. Payment via PayPal or wire transfer. (The buyer bears any costs that may arise upon payment and shipping.)

boardgame.name: Dieci 10
Goal 10
Gólkirály
boardgame.description: Goal 10 is a card game that simulates a football match. In turn, you attack the player to your left using an attack card. That player can try to defend himself by playing a defense card otherwise it will be a goal. Attacking players take one goal card and the one who has first collected five goal cards wins. In the deck, there are also special cards such as Offside, VAR and more.
